text: The 2017 William & Mary Tribe football team represented the College of William & Mary in the 2017 NCAA Division I FCS football season. The Tribe were coached by 38th-year head coach Jimmye Laycock, and the team played their home games at Zable Stadium. They were members of the Colonial Athletic Association and finished in last place (2–9 overall, 0–8 CAA). It was the first time since the 1956 season that the Tribe failed to win a single conference game. ==Schedule== ==Game summaries== ===at Virginia=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 6–28–1 | 2015 | L, 29–35 |} ===at Norfolk State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 6–0 | 2016 | W, 35–10 |} ===Bucknell=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 4–0 | 1996 | W, 47–0 |} ===Stony Brook=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 3–0 | 2016 | W, 14–9 |} ===at Elon=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 2–1 | 2016 | L, 10–27 |} ===at Delaware=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 18–23 | 2016 | W, 24–17 |} ===James Madison=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 17–22 | 2016 | L, 24–31 |} ===at Maine=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 7–5 | 2016 | L, 28–35 |} ===New Hampshire=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 15–5 | 2016 | L, 12–21 |} ===Towson=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 9–4 | 2016 | L, 24–34 |} ===at Richmond=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 62–60–5 | 2016 | W, 34–13 |} ==References== William and Mary Tribe Category:William & Mary Tribe football seasons William and Mary Tribe football
